alert.note: Alert for Baca County Including Springfield and Eastern Comanche Grasslands; Bent County Including Las Animas; Crowley County Including Ordway; Eastern Las Animas County Including Pinon Canyon; Kiowa County Including Eads; Otero County Including La Junta and Western Comanche Grasslands; Prowers County Including Lamar (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 12 at 3:26AM MDT until May 12 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning is in now in effect through 10 PM this evening for strong winds and very low relative humidity, for fire weather zones 220 through 230, which includes the mountains, valleys and I-25 corridor counties... ...A Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 7 AM through 10 PM this evening for strong winds and very low relative humidity for fire weather Zones 231 through 237, which includes the southeast plains... ...A Fire Weather Watch has been issued from late Friday morning through Friday evening for gusty winds and low relative humidity for fire weather zones 220 through 225, which includes the mountains and valleys of south central and southeast Colorado... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 231...232...233...234...235...236 AND 237... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 231...232...233...234... 235...236 and 237. * Timing...7 am to 10 pm Thursday. * Winds...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 1 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
